definition: to serve (in some capacity)/to work for
effect/efficacy/to imitate
variant of 傚|效[xiao4]
variant of 效[xiao4]/to imitate
variant of 效[xiao4]
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)

sentences.english: What about it? I may po ibly be of help.
sentences.chinese: 什么产品？也许我能效劳。

sentences.english: Pigs are born to give, to yield and to serve.
sentences.chinese: 属猪者天生乐于付出，谦让，为他人效劳。

sentences.english: Clerk: Good afternoon, madam. How can I help you?
sentences.chinese: 下午好，女士。有什么能为您效劳的吗？

sentences.english: Good morning. Housekeeping . May I help you?
sentences.chinese: 早上好，客房部。需要我效劳吗？

sentences.english: Kvin: Good morning, Hln. What can I do for you?
sentences.chinese: 早安，海伦。有什么我能效劳的吗？

sentences.english: Booking office of Cathay Pacific. May I help you?
sentences.chinese: 国泰航空公司售票处，有什么可以为你效劳吗？

sentences.english: Emily, my assistant, will help you if you find any interested items.
sentences.chinese: 如你有喜欢的产品，我的助手于莉会为你效劳。

sentences.english: Druggist: Hi. May I help you?
Ahh! nadine the beauty queen. how can I help you?
sentences.chinese: 我是美丽的女王有什么可以效劳的？

sentences.english: That is the promise our nation makes to those who serve.
sentences.chinese: 这是我们国家对于为国效劳的人们的承诺。

sentences.english: This is " new long happiness". Good morning. May I help you?
sentences.chinese: 早安，这里是新长福。能为您效劳吗？

sentences.english: Good afternoon, madam. May I help you ?
sentences.chinese: 下战书好，夫人。能为您效劳吗？

sentences.english: Supplier to its dispatch field service personnel bear full responsibility for all acts.
sentences.chinese: 供方对其派呈现场效劳人员的一切行为负全部责任。
愿为我最好的顾客效劳。

sentences.english: Salesgirl: Welcome to KFC! What can I do for you?
sentences.chinese: 欢迎光临肯德基，有什么我能效劳的？

sentences.english: A: Empire Hotel Reservations. How may I help you?
sentences.chinese: 甲:帝京酒店订房部，有什么可以为你效劳？

definition: not to refuse to (idiom)/not to hesitate to
ten thousand deaths will not prevent me (idiom); ready to risk life and limb to help out
to share tribulations/to help sb with worries and difficulties
to go through water and tread on fire (idiom); not afraid of any difficulty
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to offer one's life in sacrifice
to follow everywhere/to always be there for sb at their beck and call
to send (on errand)
wholeheartedly
to display utter loyalty/to be loyal to the end
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to vow loyalty and devotion to
not to be shirked without dishonor (idiom)/incumbent/bounden (duty)
your distinguished self/your majesty/sire
your distinguished country
should/ought
